form.name: aspnetForm

div.p: Governor Lee has closed school buildings for students physically to return for the remainder of this semester. However, the school system will continue online learning throughout the last instructional day of the school year. ECS will receive guidance as the COVID task force meets in the days to come. The feeding programs will continue as scheduled. We will be sending out information about other events important to parents and students early next week. Please continue social distancing and good hygiene to decrease the spread of the virus in our area. We will provide updates about the 2020-2021 School Year

span.p: Governor Lee has closed school buildings for students physically to return for the remainder of this semester. div.div:
Distribution for Meals:
Modified times for meal pickup starting the week of April 6, 2020. Meals will only be provided two days a week.
Monday and Wednesday only
Monday - 2 lunch meals and 2 breakfast meals will be provided with 1 of the lunch meals ready to eat.
Wednesday - 3 lunch meals and 3 breakfast meals will be provided with 1 of the lunch meals ready to eat.
Pick up times will remain 11:30 am- 12:30 pm
Students ages 18 and under will be able to receive meals during the closure at East Side Elementary, Harold McCormick Elementary, and West Side Elementary.
Northeast Tennessee School Closure Feeding Sites Map
Link https://arcg.is/Ljrqu
ARM Food Pantry - Food Boxes
Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday 10 am- 4 pm

div.a: Update From Governor Lee about School Closing
div.span: Elizabethton City Schools will remain closed and plan on students returning to school on April 27, 2020.

div.a: EHS Students Receive Renewed Attention from State Education Officials for Their Podcast Work
Escape Room at T.A. Dugger Junior High
Cyclone Football Team named State Champions at the 2019 Blue Cross Bowl

div.span: Another big win for the Cyclones when they defeated the Cougars last Friday night!

Tickets will go on sale Wednesday November 6th in the EHS athletic office for $8 and available next week online at GOFan on the athletic site.
Everyone that attends the game will need to purchase a ...
Teachers and staff at EHS used the professional development days this week to refocus on the Mission & Vision.
Now taking orders for 2019-2020 Yearbooks. For more information contact yearbook staff or Daniel Proffitt.
EHS and Crosstown students from Memphis took part in a new venture put together with our XQ super schools.
Everyone is still talking about the big win for the Cyclone Football Team against Greenville.
The newly offered Senior Capstone Class at EHS has so much to offer for students exploring their future.

div.a: Ribbon Cutting for T.A. Dugger Outdoor Classroom
div.span: The outdoor learning center was a project inspired by a trip taken by TA Dugger faculty and students to Costa Rica.

div.a: Grant To Improve Safety In Schools
div.span: The Elizabethton City School System applied for a grant earlier this year and received notification last week the grant was awarded for $470,662.

div.a: West Side Elementary promoting active living for students and the community
div.span: West Side Elementary received a grant from Niswonger Children's Hospital and Children's Miracle Network for innovative fitness in education equipment. The grant brings the Project Fit America ...

div.a: Virtual Reality Classes now being offered at EHS
div.span: Exciting news for Elizabethton High School moving towards the future. After EHS was named an XQ school last year. Funding was provided to make a phase of various projects to take place. One project ...

div.a: Community Opportunities at EHS pool for Aerobics Classes
div.span: The Community Involvement Program was created by Elizabethton City Schools with the goal of providing affordable exercise opportunities for community members living in and around Elizabethton. ...

div.a: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) partnering with EHS to better education
div.span: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) visited Elizabethton High School today to inform students about some of the changes in the school to better their education.

div.a: Renovation at T.A. Dugger is Encouraging a Healthy Lifestyle
div.span: A room T.A. Dugger once used as a catch all is now an amazing fitness room for faculty and students. The idea for the renovation started with a vision from Travis Williams.

div.a: Grant to provide SRO's in all Elizabethton City Elementary Schools
div.span: Elizabethton City Schools is starting the school year off safer in each elementary school. Grant funding by the state was awarded to Elizabethton City Schools. The funding will provide an SRO (School ...

p.br: XQ Super School of 18 in USA

div.p: The primary mission of the Elizabethton City School System is the development and growth of its children in knowledge and skills which enable them to achieve their potential as complete human beings, sharing in and contributing to the enjoyment and enrichment of their own lives, the lives of others, of the community, and the world as a whole.

Opportunity for employment, as well as continuation and advancement in employment, shall be afforded equally to members of all races, creeds, colors, sexes, religions, ages, national origins, and individuals with disabilities or veteran status with regard only for qualifications for the position involved.
